positive.review:
I found it very enjoyable, being able to begin a run with a build in mind is great for trying out new builds, there's a variety of weapons to pick from and alter to mesh with your build, the telegraphing is good, the inventory management is my favorite part. 
I don't really write reviews but I did enjoy this game enough that I thought I would share

The first time I played it it felt like it falls a fair bit shorter then dungreed, but booting it up again after a few months the game feels really good.
Some builds feel much stronger then others but the game feels beatable with anything even on high ascension levels.
Can't wait for 1.0

Dungreed was an amazing game and Sephiria feels like a great follow up keeping some of the good mechanics charm from the previous title but with fresh and enjoyable style of gameplay along with a lot of new systems and improvements. Music and Art great as always. Inventory management has also been a massive upgrade to the build creativity. 

Thankyou TEAM HORAY :)

Edit: Didn't want to give a score before, but for sure 10/10. S Tier gaming right here 100% no exaggeration.  The trailer is a literal RUSE.  Which is a beautiful thing.

Woooahhhh!! OwO

This game has hints of everything you'd ever want in an arpg roguelike, within its graphical paradigm of course. (Multiplayer, thank the heavens, and more content than I was anticipating for sure.)

It doesn't look like a grandiose experience from the steam page, you're just going to have to trust, because I don't want a spoil a dang thing.

As a wise noob once said: Bnuy = Buy
Super fun roguelike runner! lots of gameplay if you like hands on and lots of upgrading each runthrough.

This is probably one of the best roguelikes I have played in years. The items and gameplay are somewhat basic, but still entertaining. The item sets are a very nice touch, and they work very well with the games main gimmick: The inventory management. The inventory and tablet system is so incredibly well made and fun, it elevates a good, basic roguelike into a unique and great little game. The graphics are also very cute, and the weapon upgrades are fun and different enough to feel good. Currently the story is unfinished, and somewhat short, but still fun, and there is about 10-15 hours of content if you are interested in the endgame content. The Customizable endgame is very cool, nothing super special but definetly engaging. There is coop, which i havent had a chance to try, but it sounds like a very cool idea.
all over, 9/10 game, my only realistic criticism is the comparatively low amount of content, which will likely be fixed with updates over time
It's a rockin' game, at the time of writing, not done yet, but it has enough content that you can have fun, and then get antsy for more updates later.
Genuinely the most fun game roguelike game I've played in a while. Even more fun with friends!
Build variety is solid, inventory as your build is fun and interesting, cute murder bunnies.
I've seen the game from DF's member only videos. I like roguelike games. Tried the demo and got instantly hooked. Looking forward to content up until 1.0 release.

simliar to "enter the gungeon" in style, but a much better experience. Perfect co-op, and a perfect game with so much depth. So many combinations for builds that after 23 hours I still haven't tried anything. Truly a masterpiece
Highly Recommend  :D was such an amazing game cant wait till the next chapter is out!!!

So far I really l like the combat, and world. Right now I am not sure I feel about the tablet system, its unique on one hand but cumbersome on the other. When in a multiplayer game much of the time can be spent optimizing and that adds at least 20 minutes to a run. If you like inventory management roguelikes I'm sure this would feel better to you but not to me personally. It is still a good game and I can't wait to see what changes in Chapter 3 onward.

An action RPG roguelite with very fun gameplay and interesting build-crafting mechanics, which comes packaged in a cozy pixel artstyle with very cute character designs and a very lovely and memorable soundtrack. 10/10 I can recommend it. ^^
Very fun game with lots of build paths and potentials. The developers are always updating and reading community suggestions. highly recommend!
a great rouge like but the multi player is a bit confusing but when you find out how it's so much fun with friends and by your self

i really liked this game !! im excited for updates and to watch it progress as the devs work toward the full release. the current campaign is long enough (in my opinion) to keep a new player going while that happens. ive already finished it, and i thought it was a lot of fun and had a good story. (it also encourages you to actually play more, rather than just listening to a bunch of dialogue over and over, which i enjoy) and the progression is really nice too! i dont think i would have anything negative to say about it ^^
Pretty good game, still needs some content. It does have very strong meta-progression (Which Im not a huge fan of). It is also very easy to get a particular build (Many choices).
Fantastic game with constant iterations and balancing that developers put their heart into while taking constant community feedback into consideration.

Fun game. Updates have improved items and made some more viable. Weapons have branching upgrade paths, with some being far superior to others. Each weapon feels unique and can be used to win if learned properly.

Adorably cute on the first glance, deceptively difficult to master. This game for early access has so much potential and the dev's are putting in the work to make sure its getting the proper treatment. They work well to balance things and change others that just arent quite working as planned. You wont be disappointed.
Already in the start of early access it was peak and it is keep getting better. 10/10 Would recommend the games from the developer again.

Great Roguelite with a vast amount of build options. Each weapon feels unique and has their own features as well as having several upgrades to choose from. 
Artifacts collected during the run give unique single and set effects and have to be sorted in a backpack similar to Backpack Heroes system. 
The Co-Op is implemented very well, you can share a lobby and go back to your personal village to finish quests without breaking the connection so you can get back in the action even faster.
Big recommendation, especially for coop <3
This game started out okay, but all the updates have made it amazing. They have greatly increased the replay ability with all the new builds. I can't get enough of this game.

This game is ridiculously good. I'm not even a big fan of rouge-likes, but this game is phenomenal. Several very different weapon choices with the artifact options keeping every run feeling different enough that I can play through several runs without getting bored. The balance of difficulty is also really well done, especially once you get farther and can change things to make the game harder in a way that's fun for you.

I felt like Sephiria respected my time and my decision item wise. It has alot to offer and has its own logic and uniqueness.
 I had alot of fun and remembered my time playing Dungreed.  
 Cant wait for more content!
very fun game especially with all the updates to hop back on to try a couple runs great game
40+ hours. The game is fantastic. If you are on the fence, get it. Updates have been all great QOL improvements. Looking forward to 1.0
good fun with friends, fun meta progression, and lots of animals

I rabbit. I go in dungeon. I fight evil things. 10/10
P.S. Don't go in the clothing store basement.
pretty good roguelike, bought after playing its demo. has coop too
Pretty good, Just wish you could drop to act 2 to farm hard mode faster
Really good top down rogue like with a lot of content. Pure gem.

Roguelike with forest critters.......

Do I need to say more?
This gameâ€™s rabbit classes lack distinct gameplay and have limited content, but its backpack slate system is unique. Give this little game a try!
cute roguelite game with intense battle

Don't sleep on this if you like action rogue-lites.

Just buy it.
the range of builds really make this game what it is
Donâ€™t judge the game by its cover. itâ€™s insanely fun.
very good but cant sex the tree
Great game! Love the co-op.

Good Name

Really fun game too
I wish there was more. I need more. Give more. Please.
10/10 if you give it a bit of time!
good game.
Great game!
solid game
it's cool

I found it very enjoyable, being able to begin a run with a build in mind is great for trying out new builds, there's a variety of weapons to pick from and alter to mesh with your build, the telegraphing is good, the inventory management is my favorite part. 
I don't really write reviews but I did enjoy this game enough that I thought I would share

fun mechanics, good build variety.
this game has a lot of potential
love this game. Art is adorable, game play is fast and fun. Items and backpack management are unique. Dev's still update. All around a good time.

The first time I played it it felt like it falls a fair bit shorter then dungreed, but booting it up again after a few months the game feels really good.
Some builds feel much stronger then others but the game feels beatable with anything even on high ascension levels.
Can't wait for 1.0

Its a nice game whether you go into it blind or with some prior knowledge. 
Most stats are fairly well balanced, and you can build your character in pretty much any way you want, now, some things are more viable than others, but you can make an absolutely insane character in various ways, now, I havent made a tank build work yet, nor a pure ranged build, and the dagger build is a bit too RNG, I like it, but if you dont get the right drops, you may be screwed. Its possible to clear the game however you wish, though some paths require a lot more skill than others. 

It was worth the money, its one of the best games of its sort, as even when you fail theres some slight consolidation. But man is it a time sink. 

The reviews arent lying. But hey, 16% of the players have cleared the END game, like SUPER end game. Thats insane, thats just how good, fun and interesting the game is.

Dungreed was an amazing game and Sephiria feels like a great follow up keeping some of the good mechanics charm from the previous title but with fresh and enjoyable style of gameplay along with a lot of new systems and improvements. Music and Art great as always. Inventory management has also been a massive upgrade to the build creativity. 

Thankyou TEAM HORAY :)

Edit: Didn't want to give a score before, but for sure 10/10. S Tier gaming right here 100% no exaggeration.  The trailer is a literal RUSE.  Which is a beautiful thing.

Woooahhhh!! OwO

This game has hints of everything you'd ever want in an arpg roguelike, within its graphical paradigm of course. (Multiplayer, thank the heavens, and more content than I was anticipating for sure.)

It doesn't look like a grandiose experience from the steam page, you're just going to have to trust, because I don't want a spoil a dang thing.

As a wise noob once said: Bnuy = Buy
Super fun roguelike runner! lots of gameplay if you like hands on and lots of upgrading each runthrough.

Sephiria is a great, cozy, and fun game that provides for plenty of opportunities and build options as you traverse the dungeons of the world. 

Progression is rewarding and leaves many items and surprises to find and unlock. The enemies and difficulty increases provide for a good but fair challenge across tiers. Weapons and artifacts cover a wide variety of powers. 

Also amazing and quick updates and response from the devs. Above all else, the devs working within the community to take feedback and help mold this game for the future is a great reason to purchase and play it. 

The game is still a WIP and I HIGHLY Recommend it, a few things I would like to see:

- Better and deeper synergies between items and effects. There is so much potential here. Right now it's mostly just stat stacking to create power (which is effective), but the systems here could be one layer deeper and provide for an endless number of builds and combinations. 

- Dig deeper into the town building / restoration aspect. Also so much potential here... As we traverse dungeons there could be collectible resources (stone , wood, etc) that we can bring back to the main town / hub to rebuild different buildings in tiers that help improve different aspects of our characters. 
     - These resources could help rebuild the blacksmith that lets us upgrade base weapon stats
     - Restore the magic shop to different tiers to upgrade or even fuse spells for new items 
     - Restore the trading outpost that brings in new items (similar to pocket dimension / subspace  but more items) 
      - Make better use of the player owned housing to help buff base stats or items you can start a run with ( think like buffs to the mirror and fountain, upgraded tiers allow for a new skill in the mirror or increased pegs in the fountain which allow you start with even more items) 

- Massive expansion to the skill "tree" 

Love this game. Can't wait to see what the future holds. 

To all the Devs working on this game, amazing work and thank you!

Overall great mix of roguelike and inventory management, lots of great story and gameplay.  Translation issues or confusion can be a bit apparent but devs are great with receiving feedback and making changes to make the game better overall.
Genuinely the most fun game roguelike game I've played in a while. Even more fun with friends!

Very fun roguelike, even though it's in early access the game is still very high quality, and in my 27 hours of playing I haven't encountered any bugs. The game is quite short for now, don't expect a ton of playtime, but the main story is not yet finished, so I think the game will be longer in the future. If you are looking for a very hard and intense roguelike, I'm not sure this is for you, but if you like difficulty that is around the same level as dungreed you probably will also enjoy this game.

Good roguelike with fun inventory management. Incomplete but has great bones, looking forward to future development. The game does a good job of introducing new bosses during later runs, which adds good variety and replayability without bloating overall length.
I hope the game continues to develop. I wish the developer more strength and inspiration

Very nice game! The sounds, animations, art style are all good! Since at the end you are asking for feedback, here's mine:

1. Needs better item/power descriptions (more details please, some tooltips are ambiguous / open to interpretation).
2. The campaign is nice so far. Would be nice if there were achievements tied to finding lore from playthroughs.
3. A few easter eggs (or just 1-2 big ones that unlock something) would be nice, not just hidden areas and costumes that you get anyway from just playing the game.
4. The font sometimes makes the text not so easy to read.
5. The main area is big but feels empty. It has for example many houses that don't do anything useful (I'm sure you have plans for that though)
6. Maybe different modes: e.g. an endless mode -> enemies get progressively harder.
7. More combinations between specific groups of items (like the one for companions where if they're in the same row they get a bonus).
8. Starting armor options (besides costume), just like you've done with the weapon choices.
9. A simple tier completion leaderboard (asking too much, I know :D)

Sephiria is a 2D RPG Dungeon Crawler, the basis of the gameplay is to choose your build, combine items and melt the dungeons. it has item combos that scale with your stats like Atk.dmg, Atk.spd, CritChance&CritDamage, but also has active skills and debuffs etc. It's a trial and error type of situation in the beginning until you get the hang of it.
I enjoyed the hours spent to finishing the early access of the game and I would recommend it.

 [h1] What I would suggest to the developers [/h1] 
1.Make the description of the items more clear as some are hard to understand.
2.Change the font to make the game easier to read as the clunky pixel text is difficult to the eyes.
3.A few easter eggs would be an icing on the cake! (like vampire survivors, such a simple game with so many hidden gems laying around for the player to find)
4.Home village feels empty, maybe a shop to spend sapphires in order to buy items before jumping in again.
5.Lastly, Item combinations would be nice, maybe a chaos reroll system and longer-endless dungeons as it is a shame having built an amazing character by the end and the dungeon ends there.

Looking forward to the full release, my friends and I had a blast!

This is probably one of the best roguelikes I have played in years. The items and gameplay are somewhat basic, but still entertaining. The item sets are a very nice touch, and they work very well with the games main gimmick: The inventory management. The inventory and tablet system is so incredibly well made and fun, it elevates a good, basic roguelike into a unique and great little game. The graphics are also very cute, and the weapon upgrades are fun and different enough to feel good. Currently the story is unfinished, and somewhat short, but still fun, and there is about 10-15 hours of content if you are interested in the endgame content. The Customizable endgame is very cool, nothing super special but definetly engaging. There is coop, which i havent had a chance to try, but it sounds like a very cool idea.
all over, 9/10 game, my only realistic criticism is the comparatively low amount of content, which will likely be fixed with updates over time
It's a rockin' game, at the time of writing, not done yet, but it has enough content that you can have fun, and then get antsy for more updates later.
Build variety is solid, inventory as your build is fun and interesting, cute murder bunnies.
I've seen the game from DF's member only videos. I like roguelike games. Tried the demo and got instantly hooked. Looking forward to content up until 1.0 release.

simliar to "enter the gungeon" in style, but a much better experience. Perfect co-op, and a perfect game with so much depth. So many combinations for builds that after 23 hours I still haven't tried anything. Truly a masterpiece
Highly Recommend  :D was such an amazing game cant wait till the next chapter is out!!!

So far I really l like the combat, and world. Right now I am not sure I feel about the tablet system, its unique on one hand but cumbersome on the other. When in a multiplayer game much of the time can be spent optimizing and that adds at least 20 minutes to a run. If you like inventory management roguelikes I'm sure this would feel better to you but not to me personally. It is still a good game and I can't wait to see what changes in Chapter 3 onward.

An action RPG roguelite with very fun gameplay and interesting build-crafting mechanics, which comes packaged in a cozy pixel artstyle with very cute character designs and a very lovely and memorable soundtrack. 10/10 I can recommend it. ^^
Very fun game with lots of build paths and potentials. The developers are always updating and reading community suggestions. highly recommend!
a great rouge like but the multi player is a bit confusing but when you find out how it's so much fun with friends and by your self

i really liked this game !! im excited for updates and to watch it progress as the devs work toward the full release. the current campaign is long enough (in my opinion) to keep a new player going while that happens. ive already finished it, and i thought it was a lot of fun and had a good story. (it also encourages you to actually play more, rather than just listening to a bunch of dialogue over and over, which i enjoy) and the progression is really nice too! i dont think i would have anything negative to say about it ^^
Pretty good game, still needs some content. It does have very strong meta-progression (Which Im not a huge fan of). It is also very easy to get a particular build (Many choices).
Fantastic game with constant iterations and balancing that developers put their heart into while taking constant community feedback into consideration.

Fun game. Updates have improved items and made some more viable. Weapons have branching upgrade paths, with some being far superior to others. Each weapon feels unique and can be used to win if learned properly.

Adorably cute on the first glance, deceptively difficult to master. This game for early access has so much potential and the dev's are putting in the work to make sure its getting the proper treatment. They work well to balance things and change others that just arent quite working as planned. You wont be disappointed.
Already in the start of early access it was peak and it is keep getting better. 10/10 Would recommend the games from the developer again.

Great Roguelite with a vast amount of build options. Each weapon feels unique and has their own features as well as having several upgrades to choose from. 
Artifacts collected during the run give unique single and set effects and have to be sorted in a backpack similar to Backpack Heroes system. 
The Co-Op is implemented very well, you can share a lobby and go back to your personal village to finish quests without breaking the connection so you can get back in the action even faster.
Big recommendation, especially for coop <3
This game started out okay, but all the updates have made it amazing. They have greatly increased the replay ability with all the new builds. I can't get enough of this game.

This game is ridiculously good. I'm not even a big fan of rouge-likes, but this game is phenomenal. Several very different weapon choices with the artifact options keeping every run feeling different enough that I can play through several runs without getting bored. The balance of difficulty is also really well done, especially once you get farther and can change things to make the game harder in a way that's fun for you.

I felt like Sephiria respected my time and my decision item wise. It has alot to offer and has its own logic and uniqueness.
 I had alot of fun and remembered my time playing Dungreed.  
 Cant wait for more content!
very fun game especially with all the updates to hop back on to try a couple runs great game
40+ hours. The game is fantastic. If you are on the fence, get it. Updates have been all great QOL improvements. Looking forward to 1.0
good fun with friends, fun meta progression, and lots of animals

I rabbit. I go in dungeon. I fight evil things. 10/10
P.S. Don't go in the clothing store basement.

Sephiria is a really fun roguelike (roguelite? idk), and it has a lot of potential to improve with more content. Don't let that fool you, however, as there are still many hours of gameplay available in early access. From the main story, to hard mode, costume re-skins after you've completed your talent tree, and of course many many fun builds to play, Sephiria already has a lot to offer in terms of mechanics, completion, and build variety. I would highly recommend anyone who likes roguelikes with mechanical skill expression to try it out!
super fun roguelite and with good and semi complex builds, i am really hyped for the next updates

Excellent game with insane quality, lacking bugs and a addicting design. 
i
BUUNNNNYYY MURDERRRR YESSSS, but yes its a good game, better with friends.

Easily the best Game i bought in Years. im not Kidding. It doesnt get stale, you can always find new challenges and its a lot of fun. It honeslty helped me becoming a better player to begin with

Highly recomand it
Fun and addictive game!! Definitely worth the price

disconnect resets the whole run which is stupid, make a save point atleast after killing the first boss

-- DISCLAIMER: THIS GAME IS GOOD! --
This review is specifically for multiplayer.
-------------------------------------------
the game itself looks really good and is satisfying to play.
unfortunately, when trying to play with friends over long distances, the game is unplayable.
ping is terrible -- well over 1000 ping. other games we do not have these issues.
that is the only reason i'm leaving a negative review, and i and my friends had to refund since we planned to play exclusively together.
if you have friends close by or are playing singleplayer, this game is great.
i will edit this review if the long-distance ping issues are fixed.
